column4: hey folks, having wireless trouble (massive packet loss on all networks; network cuts out intermittently; drastically long pings/latency at random intervals). happens on all networks, but wasn't happening until i installed my new router. any ideas?
wired network works without a hitch.
MichaelH: my router?
> new router
right, the new router seemed to set it off, but now my laptop has trouble with all wireless networks.
regardless of restarts, using google DNS, etc. i thought it might be a dns problem, but it also does it with straight IP addresses now.
(it being, huge latency after operating for anywhere between 1-10 minutes, and eventually all hosts become unreachable)
have tried flushing my routing tables, etc.
thats weird
extremely. i'm honestly beginning to wonder if the wireless hardware sustained some kind of physical bump.
sounds like it what card?
i forget--let me check.
ok
csis: incidentally, DNS lookups are almost always dreadfully slow--wired OR wireless. been using google's DNS without improvement.
device is intel  PRO/Wireless 5100 AGN
no probs before?
before the new router? nope.
worked without a hitch on other wireless networks as well.
new router is the linksys e1000, which i'm going to replace. it is an awful machine.
indeed, but why would other wireless networks not work?
not sure
will tinker around with it further and see if i can't get it ironed out.
appreciate the thoughts.
no prob good luck buddy
